variant.bodyText: Books listed below that are marked with a t have been selected for review in a future issue, and reviewers have been assigned to each. Authors and publishers who wish their books to be considered for review in Com- putational Linguistics should send a copy to the book review editor, Graeme Hirst, De- partment of Computer Science, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada M5S 1A4. All books received will be listed, but not all can be re- viewed. Readers who wish to review books for the journal should contact the book review editor, outlining their qualifications, by writ- ing to the address above or sending elec- tronic mail to gh@cs.toronto.edu. Obviously, we cannot promise the availability of books in anyone's exact area of interest. fText and Technology: In Honour of John Sinclair Mona Baker, Gill Francis, and Elena Tognini-Bonelli (editors) Amsterdam and Philadelphia: John Benjamins, 1993, xii + 361 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 1-55619-494-3 (in the U.S.) and 90-272-2138-3 (in Europe), $69.00, Dfl 125.00 tChallenges in Natural Language Processing Madeleine Bates and Ralph M. Weischedel (editors) (BBN Systems and Technologies) Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press (Studies in Natural Language Processing, edited by Branimir K. Boguraev), 1993, xi + 296 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-521-41015-0, $49.95 Idioms: Processing, Structure, and Interpretation Cristina Cacciari and Patrizia Tabossi (editors) (University of Bologna and University of Ferrara) Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates 1993, xviii + 337 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-8058-1038-2, $69.95 Associative Engines: Connectionism, Concepts, and Representational Change Andy Clark (University of Sussex) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press, 1993, xiii + 252 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-262-03210-4, $29.95 The Proceedings of the Twenty-Fourth Annual Child Language Research Forum [April 3-5, 1992, Stanford University] Eve V. Clark (editor) (Stanford University) Stanford: Stanford Linguistics Association and the Center for the Study of Language and Information, 1993, ix + 228 pp., distributed by the University of Chicago Press. Hardbound, ISBN 1-881526-05-4, $39.95; paperbound, ISBN 1-881526-04-6, $17.95 Heads in Grammatical Theory Greville G. Corbett, Norman M. Fraser, and Scott McGlashan (editors) (University of Surrey) Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, 1993, ix + 340 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-521-42070-9, $59.95 Computers in Context: The Philosophy and Practice of Systems Design Bo Dahlbom and Lars Mathiassen (Chalmers University of Technology and Aalborg University Centre) Cambridge, MA and Oxford: NCC Blackwell, 1993, x + 306 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 1-55786-430-6, $49.95 Second Language Acquisition: An Introductory Course Susan M. Gass and Larry Selinker (Michigan State University and University of Michigan) Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates (Topics in Applied Psycholinguistics Series, edited by Sheldon Rosenberg), 1994, xvi 357 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-8058-0493-5, $79.95; paperbound, ISBN 0-8058-0494-3, $34.50 An MT Oriented Model of Aspect and Article Semantics Barbara Gawronska (Lund University) Lund, Sweden: Lund University Press (Travaux de l'Institut de Linguistique de Lund 28), 1993, 246 pp.; reprinted from the author's dissertation, Department of Linguistics, Lund University. Paperbound, ISBN 91-7966-237-4, SEK 223.00 The Last Phonological Rule: Reflections on Constraints and Derivations John Goldsmith (editor) (University of Chicago) Chicago: The University of Chicago Press (Studies in Contemporary Linguistics Series, edited by John Goldsmith, James D. McCawley, arid Jerrold M. Sadock), 1993, v + 239 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-226-30154-0, $55.00; paperbound, ISBN 0-226-30155-9, $21.95

Paperbound, ISBN 0-262-58124-8, $18.95 tFrom Discourse to Logic: Introduction to Modeltheoretic [sic] Semantics of Natural Language, Formal Logic and Discourse Representation Theory Hans Kamp and Uwe Reyle (University of Stuttgart) Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers
variant.bodyText: (Studies in Linguistics and Philosophy, edited by Gennaro Chierchia, Pauline Jacobson, and Francis J. Pelletier, Volume 42), 1993, viii + 713 pp. in two volumes. Hardbound, Part 1 ISBN 0-7923-1027-6, no price listed; Part 2, ISBN 0-7923-2402-1, no price listed; two volume set, ISBN 0-7923-2403-X, $172.00, £112.00, Dfl 280.- Phonology in Generative Grammar Michael Kenstowicz (MIT) Cambridge, MA and Oxford: Blackwell Publishers (Blackwell Textbooks in Linguistics), 1994, xi + 704 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 1-55786-425-X, $64.95; paperbound, ISBN 1-55786-426-8, $24.95 Representing Uncertain Knowledge: An Artificial Intelligence Approach Paul Krause and Dominic Clark (Imperial Cancer Research Fund, London) Oxford: Intellect Books and Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers, 1993, ix + 277 pp. Hardbound, -ISBN 0-7923-2433-1, no price listed; paperbound, ISBN 1-871516-17-X, £14.95 fThe Functional Treatment of Parsing René Leermakers (Institute for Perception Research, Eindhoven) Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers (The Kluwer International Series in Engineering and Computer Science; Natural Language Processing and Machine Translation, edited by Jaime Carbonell, Volume 242), 1993, xvi + 158 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-7923-9376-7, $79.95, £57.50, Dfl 160,- Intelligent Behavior in Animals and Robots David McFarland and Thomas Bosser (University of Oxford and Westfalische Wilhelms-Universitat) Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press (Complex Adaptive Systems Series), 1993, xi + 308 pp. Hardbound, ISBN 0-262-13293-1, $39.95
